<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return the least common multiple type of \\p OrigTy and \\p TargetTy, by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// changing the number of vector elements or scalar bitwidth. The intent is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// G&#95;MERGE&#95;VALUES, G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR, or G&#95;CONCAT&#95;VECTORS can be constructed from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\p OrigTy elements, and unmerged into \\p TargetTy. It is an error to call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this function where one argument is a fixed vector and the other is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// scalable vector, since it is illegal to build a G&#95;&#123;MERGE|UNMERGE&#125;&#95;VALUES</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// between fixed and scalable vectors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a39557b142c7bfcc54d3874aae7084907">LLVM&#95;READNONE</a></span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a39557b142c7bfcc54d3874aae7084907">LLVM&#95;READNONE</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return smallest type that covers both \\p OrigTy and \\p TargetTy and is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><span class="doxyHighlight">LLT <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa47ab206f485fe45e4d8a882ff00fd42">getCoverTy</a>(LLT OrigTy, LLT TargetTy);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return a type where the total size is the greatest common divisor of \\p</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// OrigTy and \\p TargetTy. This will try to either change the number of vector</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// elements, or bitwidth of scalars. The intent is the result type can be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as the result of a G&#95;UNMERGE&#95;VALUES from \\p OrigTy, and then some</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// combination of G&#95;MERGE&#95;VALUES, G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR and G&#95;CONCAT&#95;VECTORS (possibly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// with intermediate casts) can re-form \\p TargetTy.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="382"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If these are vectors with different element types, this will try to produce</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a vector with a compatible total size, but the element type of \\p OrigTy. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this can&#39;t be satisfied, this will produce a scalar smaller than the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="385"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// original vector elements. It is an error to call this function where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="386"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// one argument is a fixed vector and the other is a scalable vector, since it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="387"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is illegal to build a G&#95;&#123;MERGE|UNMERGE&#125;&#95;VALUES between fixed and scalable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="388"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// vectors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="389"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In the worst case, this returns LLT::scalar(1)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a39557b142c7bfcc54d3874aae7084907">LLVM&#95;READNONE</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlight">LLT <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#adb74ac5c2f2a45c7247a785f898d4833">getGCDType</a>(LLT OrigTy, LLT TargetTy);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Represents a value which can be a Register or a constant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is useful in situations where an instruction may have an interesting</span></CodeLine>
